ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.inventory

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cmput301.t03.inventory.Inventory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Filterable<Item>, Adaptable, Observable, Observer, java.lang.Iterable<Item>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BrowsableInventories

    public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
implements Filterable<Item>, Observable, Observer, Adaptable, java.lang.Iterable<Item>
    Inventory maintains a collection of items and will notify the observing user of any changes. Represents the main model for the userinventory workflow and the browse inventories workflow.

      Should be constructed by the systems singleton or a User itself via the getInventory method, and further managed by the data manager.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Inventory

        public Inventory()
        Should be constructed by the systems singleton or a User itself via the getInventory method, and further managed by the data manager. Creates a new inventory that can be watched and added/removed to/from.

    • Method Detail

      • getItems

        public java.util.HashMap<java.util.UUID,Item> getItems()
        Get the hashmap of items. Used by anyone needing to grab the inventory. Examples: BrowsingFriends, Browsing Self.
        Returns:
        the hashmap of items

      • getItem

        public Item getItem(java.util.UUID itemUUID)
        Get an Item from the inventory model. Examples usages: Inspecting an Item, drawing items to ListView in inventory obtaining item data in a trade.
        Parameters:
        itemUUID - the item's UUID
        Returns:
        the item
